body:
Comment 13: 
Arithmetic operations naturally take on the types of the operands.  That is not true of
comparisons.  I can't see any reason why comparisons of constants should produce a type
different from that of comparisons of non-constants.  The fact that the operands are
untyped says nothing about the type of a comparison.

I'm OK with deciding that the type of a comparison is always the named type "bool".
